extendedInfo.description: At the 2011 ACU Connected Summit, the world's top minds explore the future of education and mobile technology. Come and be inspired by perspectives from education, technology and public policy; share best practices and ongoing innovation in mobile learning; and receive access to the people and organizations who will build the future of education.The Connected Summit features 77 sessions from leading experts & practitioners in K-20 mobile-learning and emerging pedagogies, with tracks focusing on media & mobility, teaching & learning, the future of books, K-12 education, infrastructure & logistics, research and campus spotlights.You'll be face-to-face with international leaders in education, technology and public policy, including Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak, Pearson eCollege vice president of product Adrian Sannier and U.S. Department of Education director of educational technology Karen Cator.Join these world-changers February 28 - March 1, 2011 as we explore mobile learning and the emerging role of digital books.
